title: MarketWatch Options Trader: In focus: False scare?
text:
Free Preview 
For full access, Log in or Subscribe Now and get 4 weeks free! 
On Monday, a confluence of foreign news served to put a bit of fear in the U.S. stock market. 
As measured by the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index SPX, +0.69% , prices fell over 2%, or 40 points. This immediately threw our indicators into negative territory (the ones that weren’t already there), but it also created some oversold conditions. As has been the case for nearly four years now, oversold conditions quickly become buy signals, and that is already happening again now. 
When SPX broke down on Monday, it fell below the lower end of the previous trading range (2,070). In a “normal” market, that would induce selling — and not for just a day. But there was no follow-through. Prices didn't regain the critical 2,070 area on Tuesday, but they did so today.
